intro: Armeria morisii var. maderensis, commonly known as Mader's thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the dry, rocky environments it typically inhabits. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
